intro: Myrcia oblanceolata, commonly known as Brazilian peppertree or erva-cidreira, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, with elliptical, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to a variety of soil types. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
